meanings.sent1: She becomes testy when she has to wait in long lines.
meanings.sent2: He was in a testy mood after a long day at work.
meanings.sent3: The testy cat meowed loudly when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The testy customer's complaints were like thunder on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The testy teacher's sharp words left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: Showing impatience or a bad temper.
meanings.sent1: The testy child kept tapping his foot while waiting for his turn.
meanings.sent2: She gave a testy reply when asked to repeat the instructions.
meanings.sent3: The testy driver honked loudly at the slow-moving car in front.
meanings.sent4: His testy attitude was like a storm brewing in the calm sea of the office.
meanings.sent5: The testy boss's glare made everyone in the room uneasy.
